item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "If you are a dreamer come in If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer If youre a pretender com sit by my fire For we have some flax golden tales to spin Come in! Come in!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by W. H. Auden
Caitlin add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "You only live twice: Once when you're born And once when you look death in the face." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Katherine Dunn
item.description: "When your mama was the geek, my dreamlets," Papa would say, "she made the nipping off of noggins such a crystal mystery that the hens themselves yearned toward her, waltzing around her, hypnotized with longing." -- Katherine Dunn

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "CLARE: The library is cool and smells like carpet cleaner, although all I can see is marble. " -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "Early this morning, 1 January 2021, three minutes after midnight, the last human being to be born on earth was killed in a pub brawl in a suburb of Buenos Aires, aged twenty-five years, two months and twelve days." -- P.D. James

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Patrick McCabe
item.description: "Although I'm afraid I don't get too many clients these days!" -- Patrick McCabe

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "all this Beethoven and rain" -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "I have spent weeks in the desert, forgetting to look at the moon, he says, as a married man may spend days never looking into the face of his wife. These are not sins of omission but signs of pre-occuopation." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "In and of itself, nothing really matters. What matters is that nothing is ever in and of itself." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Anybody who says they are a good liar obviously is not, because any legitimately savvy liar would always insist they're honest about everything." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Even though I wanted to experience all these things I was interested in, I couldn't get them. So I had to think critically and culturally about what was available. " -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "Discipleship is not an offer that man makes to Christ." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If this is going to be a Christian nation that doesn't help the poor, either we have to pretend that Jesus was just as selfish as we are, or we've got to acknowledge that He commanded us to love the poor and serve the needy without condition and then admit that we just don't want to do it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Caitlin add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "And so rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life." -- J.K. Rowling
